text: Peru competed at the 1968 Summer Olympics in Mexico City, Mexico. 28 competitors, 16 men and 12 women, took part in 21 events in 8 sports. ==Athletics== Peru qualified four athletes to the summer olympics. ;Track events {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" !rowspan="2"|Athletes !rowspan="2"|Events !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Quarterfinal !colspan="2"|Semifinal !Final ==Shooting== Five shooter represented Peru during these Olympics. Gladys Baldwin Lopez was one of the first two women, the other being Eulalia Rolińska who competed for Poland, to compete in Olympic Shooting.
